intro: Silene vulgaris var. commutata, commonly known as the common catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Silene vulgaris var. commutata is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm.
